<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s finally here.</strong> Morning Brew’s weekly podcast, <em>Business Casual</em>, is available to tickle your ears right now.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the first episode, we interviewed NYU professor Scott Galloway. He’s brilliant, he’s wicked funny, and he’ll tell you everything you need to know about breaking up Big Tech. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen now:</strong> <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/business-casual/id1480059697#episodeGuid=gid%3A%2F%2Fart19-episode-locator%2FV0%2Fza1V16i0pt_XK-ri-4_ODqHpfZCRNmd0_om5uJwIWic" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://open.spotify.com/episode/6eu5IzlEIJXBN2NSWGnisk?si=aP9BSF-ERpWDz6v-6Kzrng" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/business-casual-podcast" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">All other podcast platforms</a></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/23/thomas-cook-goes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Thomas Cooked
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Thomas Cooked" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MjcwMzMyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thomas Cook, the world’s oldest travel company, has abruptly <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/live/2019/sep/23/thomas-cook-travel-chaos-insolvency-leaves-150000-stranded-on-holidays-live-updates?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a>, leaving as many as 500,000 stranded passengers around the world feverishly Googling “max number of days it’s ok to wear the same socks.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">FYI: </strong>The 178-year-old U.K.-based firm <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/23/travel/thomas-cook-airline-collapse.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">specialized</a> in low-cost package vacations, bundling flights and accommodations in over 60 destinations around the world. All 21,000 of its employees' jobs are at risk. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How did T-Cook get here?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The money reason: </strong>In May, Thomas Cook issued its third profit warning in under a year. Its debts were approaching £2 billion ($2.5 billion), and recent emergency negotiations came up at least £200 million short.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The U.K. refused to intervene, lest it create a “moral hazard.” PM Boris Johnson said one government bailout could suggest that’s an option for </span><span><em>any</em></span><span> risky company.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And we know </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/23/business/thomas-cook-collapse/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">saving a travel firm</a></span><span>, no matter how old, isn’t priority No. 1 for 10 Downing these Brexit days.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The meta reason: </strong>Ask any college junior who recently embarked on a semester abroad—EasyJet or bust. The <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/what-thomas-cooks-collapse-says-about-modern-tourism-11569248853?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rapid rise</a> of a) low-cost European airlines and b) cheap, easy-to-book accommodations like Airbnb sucked the life out of the old-school Thomas Cook.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that it’s “ceased trading with immediate effect,” Thomas Cook has set off what U.K. officials are calling the <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/09/23/763355554/thomas-cook-airline-collapse-triggers-largest-peacetime-repatriation-in-u-k-hist?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest peacetime repatriation</a> effort in the country's history, or at least since One Direction’s “Where We Are” tour finished its North American leg.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The government has announced plans to bring back 150,000 travelers over the next two weeks. As of yesterday afternoon, they’d chartered 60 flights.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Officials haven’t disclosed the cost of the operation, but the government </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/thomas-cook-enters-compulsory-liquidation-11569206090?mod=hp_lead_pos7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">forked over</a></span><span> about $62 million to repatriate ~110,000 people when smaller tour operator Monarch Airlines folded in 2017.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/23/snaps-reportedly-tracking-zucks-cutthroat-moves-project-voldemort?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Snap Isn’t One for Subtlety
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTAxL3ZvbGRlbW9ydF8zNDM1MTAxYl9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Warner Bros.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s our takeaway from the WSJ’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/snap-detailed-facebooks-aggressive-tactics-in-project-voldemort-dossier-11569236404?mod=djemalertNEWS&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scoop</a> yesterday on the FTC’s antitrust investigation of Facebook (-1.64%). Snap’s reportedly been tracking Facebook’s more cutthroat moves in a dossier it calls “Project Voldemort.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Snap (+0.47%) isn't the only one talking to FTC investigators. The Journal’s sources say “a number of Facebook’s current and former competitors” are cooperating with the probe. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The investigation allegedly focuses on Facebook CEO <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">Tom Riddle</span> Mark Zuckerberg’s efforts to acquire or undermine potentially competitive startups...like Snap. A few examples:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook reportedly discouraged Instagram influencers from mentioning Snapchat on their accounts. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Zuckerberg gave Snap CEO Evan Spiegel an “accept my acquisition offer or you’ll get hit with an Avada Kedavra” ultimatum. Spiegel refused, so Zuck went ahead and </span><span><a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2018/06/02/american-tech-giants-are-making-life-tough-for-startups?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">copied</a></span><span> Snap's most popular features.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Horcrux of it:</strong> We’d need a college directory to catalog all the governmental bodies currently scrutinizing Facebook over antitrust. But the FTC is the one with shiny, sharp enforcement fangs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>if you've ever worked for a tech company that competed or worked with Facebook, watch out for calls from unfamiliar D.C. area codes. The FTC’s casting a wide net.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/23/google-launches-play-pass-subscription-option?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You’re Appy and You Know It Launch a Subscription Service
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Is your thumb sore after constantly closing out of in-app advertisements? Google wants to give it a hot stone massage. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday it revealed <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/23/20878843/google-play-pass-bundles-350-android-games-and-apps-for-4-99-per-month?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google Play Pass</a>, a subscription service that gives Android users access to more than 350 games and apps completely ad- and microtransaction-free. It costs $4.99/month and goes live in the U.S. this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How Play Pass works: </strong>If you sign up, you <a href="https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2019/09/google-play-pass-on-android-5mo-for-350-games-apps-sans-microtransactions/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won’t see ads</a> or be solicited to buy anything in available apps, about two-thirds of which are games. Some non-game apps include AccuWeather and Pic Stitch. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Last week, Apple<a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/apple-arcade-launch-available-1203342018/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"> launched Apple Arcade</a>, a subscription gaming service that also costs $4.99/month. But don’t get them confused...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Unlike Google’s, Apple’s games are exclusive to the service. Plus, Arcade is just that—games, not the other kinds of apps Google is offering. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The subscription model has disrupted razors, clothing, and red meat. Mobile apps could be next.</p>

MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/23/netflix-shares-dipped-red-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix Is Just Honored to Be Nominated
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday we learned that new streaming entrants are coming for Netflix like Phoebe Waller-Bridge is coming for Julia Louis-Dreyfus's Queen of Comedy crown. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon's <em>Fleabag </em>and its star, Waller-Bridge, were big winners at Sunday night’s Emmys. Netflix CEO Reed Hastings recently <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/reed-hastings-says-amazon-outbid-netflix-fleabag-1241322?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">admitted</a> Amazon outbid him for the series, per the Hollywood Reporter. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But Hastings has other problems</strong>. Netflix stock <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/23/netflix-goes-negative-for-the-year-giving-up-a-46percent-gain.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sank</a> to its lowest point of 2019 yesterday, erasing its entire 46% gain for the year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1569273642.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/23/netflix-goes-negative-for-the-year-giving-up-a-46percent-gain.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNBC</a></em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> The threat of more competition is driving Netflix shares down. Many investors still believe in the OG weekend-swallower, just not at its lofty valuation.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/23/venture-invest-sweetgreen?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Venture This: Hold onto Your Kale Caesars
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTAyL2FsbC1ib3dscy1fanBnLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sweetgreen</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Welcome to Venture This, where we toss out a startup generating buzz...then ask: would you invest?</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sweetgreen, the salad chain specializing in hexagonal troughs of leafy greens, has closed a <a href="https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20190923005568/en/sweetgreen-Raises-150-Million-Financing-Mission-Making?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$150 million funding round</a> that values it at $1.6 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sweetgreen has now raised over $500 million since its 2007 founding. But to invest in a fast casual chain, you need to know the difference between your shaved parm and your parm crisps...plus have a decent risk tolerance.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Restaurants have </span><span><a href="https://theoutline.com/post/7996/sweetgreen-tech-company?zd=1&zi=q4v7cqvp&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tons of overhead</a></span><span> and are the opposite of margin machines.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Sweetgreen’s investors bought in “with the hopes that this will be a public company one day,” <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/salad-chain-sweetgreens-tech-focus-helps-push-valuation-to-1-6-billion-11569008888?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>. No surprise, then, that this $150 million will further <a href="https://thespoon.tech/sweetgreen-raises-150m-in-fresh-funding-announces-in-house-delivery-program/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">techy goals</a> like…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Delivery capabilities in its app</strong></span><span>, launching in 2020 to streamline the over 50% of Sweetgreen orders placed digitally.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Outpost</strong></span><span>, Sweetgreen’s office delivery program. A year ago, there were 13 Outpost locations; Sweetgreen wants 600 by year-end.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ok, Brewquoia Capital—would you invest in Sweetgreen? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/WZ9i6H?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tell us here</a>.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/24/business-casual-episode-1-breakup?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Business Casual Episode 1: The Breakup
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<img alt="Business Casual Episode 1: The Breakup" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MjczMjk4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">After Stuffed Cheez-It Pizza,</strong> the question of whether to break up Big Tech might be the most important business story of our generation. But do you know how chopping up a company like Facebook would actually work? Or why we would do it? Or who benefits? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There is no one better to walk us through this than NYU professor Scott Galloway. He’s no ordinary professor. For one, he lets us call him Scott. Second, he’s more quotable than Shakespeare. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are a few Galloway-isms from the first episode of <em>Business Casual</em>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"I don't think [social media CEOs] wake up and say we want to promote bad content. What they wake up and say is we want to sell more Chobani ads."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"</span><span><span>My only investment advice to all your listeners is always invest in unregulated monopolies. That's the only investment advice you ever need</span></span><span>."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Thanks for having me."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You're welcome, Scott. And we are giving readers full permission to stop reading this newsletter now and listen to the episode. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How to listen: </strong><a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/business-casual/id1480059697#episodeGuid=gid%3A%2F%2Fart19-episode-locator%2FV0%2Fza1V16i0pt_XK-ri-4_ODqHpfZCRNmd0_om5uJwIWic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://open.spotify.com/episode/6eu5IzlEIJXBN2NSWGnisk?si=aP9BSF-ERpWDz6v-6Kzrng&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/business-casual-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">All other podcast platforms</a></p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e All of the hype, none of the price action. Those bitcoin futures we told you about yesterday \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-22/bitcoin-is-growing-up-as-deliverable-futures-start-trading?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etraded\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e thinly on Day 1, and the price of bitcoin itself sank a little.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUN meeting: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt the Climate Action Summit, 16-year-old activist Greta Thunberg gave a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://npr.org/2019/09/23/763389015/this-is-all-wrong-greta-thunberg-tells-world-leaders-at-u-n-climate-session?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erousing speech\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. “How dare you?” she asked leaders. “You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words...people are suffering. People are dying. Entire ecosystems are collapsing.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTRAVEL \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/23/thomas-cook-goes?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThomas Cooked\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Thomas Cooked\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MjcwMzMyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThomas Cook, the world’s oldest travel company, has abruptly \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/live/2019/sep/23/thomas-cook-travel-chaos-insolvency-leaves-150000-stranded-on-holidays-live-updates?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e, leaving as many as 500,000 stranded passengers around the world feverishly Googling “max number of days it’s ok to wear the same socks.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFYI: \u003c/strong\u003eThe 178-year-old U.K.-based firm \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/23/travel/thomas-cook-airline-collapse.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003especialized\u003c/a\u003e in low-cost package vacations, bundling flights and accommodations in over 60 destinations around the world. All 21,000 of its employees' jobs are at risk. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow did T-Cook get here?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe money reason: \u003c/strong\u003eIn May, Thomas Cook issued its third profit warning in under a year. Its debts were approaching £2 billion ($2.5 billion), and recent emergency negotiations came up at least £200 million short.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe U.K. refused to intervene, lest it create a “moral hazard.” PM Boris Johnson said one government bailout could suggest that’s an option for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eany\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e risky company.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd we know \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/23/business/thomas-cook-collapse/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaving a travel firm\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, no matter how old, isn’t priority No. 1 for 10 Downing these Brexit days.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe meta reason: \u003c/strong\u003eAsk any college junior who recently embarked on a semester abroad—EasyJet or bust. The \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/what-thomas-cooks-collapse-says-about-modern-tourism-11569248853?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erapid rise\u003c/a\u003e of a) low-cost European airlines and b) cheap, easy-to-book accommodations like Airbnb sucked the life out of the old-school Thomas Cook.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow that it’s “ceased trading with immediate effect,” Thomas Cook has set off what U.K. officials are calling the \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/09/23/763355554/thomas-cook-airline-collapse-triggers-largest-peacetime-repatriation-in-u-k-hist?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargest peacetime repatriation\u003c/a\u003e effort in the country's history, or at least since One Direction’s “Where We Are” tour finished its North American leg.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe government has announced plans to bring back 150,000 travelers over the next two weeks. As of yesterday afternoon, they’d chartered 60 flights.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOfficials haven’t disclosed the cost of the operation, but the government \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/thomas-cook-enters-compulsory-liquidation-11569206090?mod=hp_lead_pos7\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eforked over\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about $62 million to repatriate ~110,000 people when smaller tour operator Monarch Airlines folded in 2017.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s our takeaway from the WSJ’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/snap-detailed-facebooks-aggressive-tactics-in-project-voldemort-dossier-11569236404?mod=djemalertNEWS\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escoop\u003c/a\u003e yesterday on the FTC’s antitrust investigation of Facebook (-1.64%). Snap’s reportedly been tracking Facebook’s more cutthroat moves in a dossier it calls “Project Voldemort.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSnap (+0.47%) isn't the only one talking to FTC investigators. The Journal’s sources say “a number of Facebook’s current and former competitors” are cooperating with the probe. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe investigation allegedly focuses on Facebook CEO \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003eTom Riddle\u003c/span\u003e Mark Zuckerberg’s efforts to acquire or undermine potentially competitive startups...like Snap. A few examples:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFacebook reportedly discouraged Instagram influencers from mentioning Snapchat on their accounts. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eZuckerberg gave Snap CEO Evan Spiegel an “accept my acquisition offer or you’ll get hit with an Avada Kedavra” ultimatum. Spiegel refused, so Zuck went ahead and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.economist.com/business/2018/06/02/american-tech-giants-are-making-life-tough-for-startups?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecopied\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Snap's most popular features.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Horcrux of it:\u003c/strong\u003e We’d need a college directory to catalog all the governmental bodies currently scrutinizing Facebook over antitrust. But the FTC is the one with shiny, sharp enforcement fangs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eif you've ever worked for a tech company that competed or worked with Facebook, watch out for calls from unfamiliar D.C. area codes. Service\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIs your thumb sore after constantly closing out of in-app advertisements? Google wants to give it a hot stone massage. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday it revealed \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/23/20878843/google-play-pass-bundles-350-android-games-and-apps-for-4-99-per-month?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGoogle Play Pass\u003c/a\u003e, a subscription service that gives Android users access to more than 350 games and apps completely ad- and microtransaction-free. It costs $4.99/month and goes live in the U.S. this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow Play Pass works: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you sign up, you \u003ca href=\"https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2019/09/google-play-pass-on-android-5mo-for-350-games-apps-sans-microtransactions/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewon’t see ads\u003c/a\u003e or be solicited to buy anything in available apps, about two-thirds of which are games. Some non-game apps include AccuWeather and Pic Stitch. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eLast week, Apple\u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/apple-arcade-launch-available-1203342018/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e launched Apple Arcade\u003c/a\u003e, a subscription gaming service that also costs $4.99/month. But don’t get them confused...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnlike Google’s, Apple’s games are exclusive to the service. Plus, Arcade is just that—games, not the other kinds of apps Google is offering. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe subscription model has disrupted razors, clothing, and red meat. But to invest in a fast casual chain, you need to know the difference between your shaved parm and your parm crisps...plus have a decent risk tolerance.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRestaurants have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://theoutline.com/post/7996/sweetgreen-tech-company?zd=1\u0026zi=q4v7cqvp\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etons of overhead\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and are the opposite of margin machines.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Sweetgreen’s investors bought in “with the hopes that this will be a public company one day,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/salad-chain-sweetgreens-tech-focus-helps-push-valuation-to-1-6-billion-11569008888?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. No surprise, then, that this $150 million will further \u003ca href=\"https://thespoon.tech/sweetgreen-raises-150m-in-fresh-funding-announces-in-house-delivery-program/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etechy goals\u003c/a\u003e like…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDelivery capabilities in its app\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, launching in 2020 to streamline the over 50% of Sweetgreen orders placed digitally.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOutpost\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Sweetgreen’s office delivery program.
